SENT.plain: The authors report two cases of intracranial giant aneurysms inducing acute neurological deterioration even though rupture of the aneurysms had not occurred

Neurological aggravation was attributable to the acute swelling of the aneurysmal mass after intramural hemorrhage in one case, and the formation of rapid and massive intraluminal thrombosis in another case
MRI confirmed these mechanisms in both cases
MRI is very useful for demonstrating mural and intraluminal pathologies involving giant aneurysms
